product-manager.title: Product Manager
product-manager.tagline: AI writes the spec. Humans decide what to build.

tasks.description: AI generates product requirement documents, user stories, and acceptance criteria from briefs.
AI scans competitors, tracks features, and generates comparison matrices.
AI aggregates and themes user feedback from surveys, tickets, and interviews.
AI tracks product metrics, generates dashboards, and identifies trends.
AI generates roadmap presentations and updates from planning data.
Defining what to build and why — connecting user needs to business goals — is deeply human.
Aligning engineering, design, sales, and leadership requires influence and judgment.
Deeply understanding user problems through interviews and observation is human.
Making tough priority calls with incomplete information requires business judgment.

companies.name: Productboard
companies.threat: AI-powered product management platform that auto-prioritizes features from customer data

companies.name: Anthropic
companies.threat: AI that writes PRDs, analyzes markets, and synthesizes feedback at PM quality

companies.name: Notion
companies.threat: AI workspace automating PM documentation, specs, and project tracking

companies.name: Amplitude
companies.threat: AI product analytics that auto-identifies insights and recommends actions

companies.name: Dovetail
companies.threat: AI user research platform that auto-themes and synthesizes customer feedback

timeline.description: AI handles 55% of PM documentation and analysis. PMs focus on strategy, discovery, and leadership.
AI manages product analytics and generates specs. PMs focus on vision and cross-functional alignment.
Product management evolves but remains human-centric. Strategy, empathy, and leadership can't be automated.

skills.description: Define long-term product direction — the strategic thinking AI can't replace.
Build AI-powered products — understand ML capabilities and limitations.
Deep technical understanding to make better product decisions.
Drive product-led growth and revenue — the business impact layer.
Design platforms, APIs, and ecosystems — complex strategic product thinking.

business-analyst.title: Business Analyst
business-analyst.tagline: AI crunches the data. Humans define the question.

tasks.description: AI generates BRDs, user stories, and process flows from stakeholder inputs.
AI analyzes data, creates visualizations, and generates insight reports.
AI generates process flow diagrams and identifies optimization opportunities.
AI writes SQL queries, builds dashboards, and automates data extraction.
AI generates test cases and tracks progress but coordination needs humans.
Running workshops, mediating conflicts, and facilitating decisions is human.
Understanding the real business problem beneath the stated request needs human insight.
Guiding teams through process changes and adoption requires human leadership.

companies.threat: AI-powered business intelligence generating insights from natural language

timeline.description: AI handles 60% of documentation and analysis. BAs focus on facilitation and problem-solving.
AI auto-generates reports and requirements. BAs become business transformation consultants.
Routine analysis automated. BAs focus on complex problem-solving and organizational change.

skills.description: Redesign processes for the AI era — the strategic consulting layer.
Go beyond basic analysis to predictive modeling and AI-powered insights.
Transition to product management — deeper ownership of outcomes.
Lead AI adoption projects — bridge business needs and AI capabilities.
Deep industry knowledge in healthcare, finance, or supply chain.

management-consultant.tagline: AI builds the deck. Humans sell the strategy.

tasks.description: AI gathers market data, sizes markets, and generates competitive landscapes.

AI builds financial models, scenario analyses, and business cases.
AI analyzes operational data and identifies patterns and optimization opportunities.
AI compiles industry benchmarks and case studies from knowledge bases.
Building trust and navigating client politics is human.
Defining the right problem and structuring the approach requires creativity.
Leading organizational change and managing resistance is human.
Selling consulting engagements requires human relationships.

companies.threat: AI that generates strategy decks, market analysis, and business cases

timeline.description: AI handles 55% of research and analysis. Junior demand drops 25%.
AI generates full analyses. Consultants focus on strategy and implementation.

skills.description: Move beyond strategy into execution — where real value is delivered.
Help companies adopt AI — the hottest consulting practice.
Deep domain expertise commands premium.
Influence C-suite decisions — persuasion and storytelling.
Sell and grow consulting relationships — the partner track.

tasks.description: AI predicts demand using ML models analyzing sales, weather, and market signals.
AI optimizes safety stock and reorder points across the network.
AI optimizes delivery routes, carrier selection, and last-mile logistics.
AI analyzes spending and manages supplier performance.
AI provides real-time visibility and predicts disruptions.
Negotiating with suppliers and managing quality is human.
Responding to supply chain crises requires creative problem-solving.
Designing warehouse locations and sourcing strategy needs strategic thinking.
